derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin laesio(n-), from laedere 'injure'

entry.def: A lesion is an injury or wound to someone's body.

means.word_mean: 1. any visible abnormal structural change in a bodily part
2. any break in the skin or an organ caused by violence or surgical incision
